org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Interface TransactionScope

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ThreadContextTransactionManager.AmbientThreadedTransactionScope, ThreadContextTransactionManager.EmptyTransactionScope, ThreadContextTransactionManager.NotSupportedTransaction, ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase, ThreadContextTransactionManager.WrappingTransactionScope

    public interface TransactionScope
extends AutoCloseable
    Represents a TransactionScope.
    Author:
    Gordon

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the current transaction scope.
      void commit()
      Commits the transaction immediately.
      TransactionOptions getOptions()
      Gets the options with which this transaction was opened.
      boolean isCommitted()
      Returns true if the transaction scope has been committed.
      boolean isReverted()
      Returns true if the transaction scope has been reverted.
      void putTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
      Adds a transaction listener for the ambient transaction, if it does not already exist.
      void removeTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
      Removes a transaction listener for the ambient transaction.
      void revert()
      Reverts the transaction immediately.
      void setRevertOnly()
      Sets the transaction to be "Revert Only".

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        void commit()
            throws TransactionException
        Commits the transaction immediately. Transactions are committed atomically and durably, so that the instant this method returns successfully, the caller can be assured that the modifications performed by this transaction have been saved to disk.
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if an error occurred during the commit. The transaction manager will automatically revert the transaction upon a commit error.
        IllegalTransactionStateException - if the transaction has already been committed, reverted, or is revert only.

      • revert

        void revert()
        Reverts the transaction immediately. When a transaction is reverted, the database acts as though all the modifications performed inside the transaction scope never happened.

      • setRevertOnly

        void setRevertOnly()
        Sets the transaction to be "Revert Only". The transaction will continue as normal, but will throw an IllegalStateException if commit() is called.

      • isCommitted

        boolean isCommitted()
        Returns true if the transaction scope has been committed.

        This refers to the entire transaction scope; if this transaction object was opened within a larger transaction scope, then calling commit() on this object will not result in a commit and this will return false until the larger scope is committed.

        Returns:
        true iff the entire ambient transaction successfully committed.

      • isReverted

        boolean isReverted()
        Returns true if the transaction scope has been reverted.

        If this transaction was propagated from a larger transaction scope (except by Propagation.NESTED), then this will return true if revert() has been called on ANY transaction object participating in the transaction.

        Returns:
        true iff the entire ambient transaction was reverted.

      • getOptions

        TransactionOptions getOptions()
        Gets the options with which this transaction was opened.
        Returns:
        the TransactionOptions object provided when the transaction was opened.

      • putTransactionListener

        void putTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
        Adds a transaction listener for the ambient transaction, if it does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add to the entire ambient transaction.

      • removeTransactionListener

        void removeTransactionListener(TransactionListener listener)
        Removes a transaction listener for the ambient transaction.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove from the entire ambient transaction.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the current transaction scope. If the transaction has yet to be committed or reverted, and the transaction is the last participant in the ambient transaction scope (i.e. the root scope), the entire transaction is reverted immediately.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
